overview.name: PMM Navigation System
overview.description: Core application navigation and wayfinding interface providing access to all PMM modules with persistent sidebar, responsive mobile support, notifications, and user profile access
overview.problemStatement: Users need efficient navigation between multiple complex manufacturing modules without cognitive overhead, clear awareness of critical alerts, and consistent wayfinding across devices

riskReduction: Reduced navigation errors through clear active state indicators
Faster incident response via alert badge visibility
Audit compliance through navigation history tracking
operationalEfficiency: Time savings: 7.5-30 minutes per user per day from faster module switching
Reduced training time: From 2 weeks to 1 week onboarding
Cognitive load reduction: Persistent navigation eliminates confusion
userExperience: Increased feature adoption: 40% improvement in Reportes/Configuración discovery
User satisfaction correlation with perceived system quality

successMetrics.metric: Average time to navigate to target module

successMetrics.measurement: Support ticket analysis (baseline vs 3 months post-launch)

successMetrics.metric: % of users accessing Reportes module weekly
Time from alert creation to user acknowledgment

userStories.title: Primary Module Navigation
userStories.story: As a Manufacturing Engineer, I want to navigate to any major PMM module (Dashboard, Inventario, Categorías, Alertas, Reportes, Configuración) with a single click, so that I can access the features I need immediately without searching through nested menus
acceptanceCriteria: Left sidebar displays all six primary navigation items with icons and labels
Each navigation item is clickable and navigates to the corresponding module
Active module is visually highlighted (orange background)
Navigation persists across all pages within the application
Clicking a navigation item loads the target module within 3 seconds
Clicking the currently active navigation item does not cause page reload (no-op)

userStories.title: Visual Active State Indication
userStories.story: As an Inventory Manager, I want to see which module I'm currently in at all times, so that I don't accidentally perform actions in the wrong context
acceptanceCriteria: Currently active navigation item displays orange background (#F97316 or similar)
Active item text remains white for high contrast
Active item icon is white to match text color
Inactive items have white text on dark blue background
Active state updates immediately when navigating to a different module
Only one navigation item can be active at a time
Active state is visually distinct and recognizable within 1 second

userStories.title: Sidebar Collapse/Expand
userStories.story: As a Warehouse Staff member using a tablet, I want to collapse the navigation sidebar to a compact icon-only view, so that I can maximize screen space for operational data entry while still having quick access to navigation
acceptanceCriteria: Collapse button is visible at the bottom of the sidebar (chevron icon pointing left)
Clicking collapse button transitions sidebar to icon-only mode (width ~64px)
In collapsed mode, only module icons are visible (no text labels)
Hovering over a collapsed menu item shows a tooltip with the module name
Expand button (chevron pointing right) is visible when sidebar is collapsed
Clicking expand button restores full sidebar with icons and text
Collapse/expand state persists across page navigations within the same session
Transition animation is smooth (200-300ms)
Logo area adapts in collapsed mode (shows icon only or compact version)

userStories.title: Notification Badge
userStories.story: As a Production Planner, I want to see a notification count badge on the top bar, so that I am immediately aware of critical alerts (low stock, production delays) that require my attention
acceptanceCriteria: Notification icon (bell) is visible in the top-right area of the top bar
Badge displays unread notification count (e.g., '3')
Badge uses high-visibility color (red #EF4444 or similar)
Badge is circular and positioned on the top-right of the bell icon
Clicking the notification icon opens a notification panel or navigates to Alertas module
Badge count updates in real-time when new notifications arrive (within 10 seconds)
Badge disappears when notification count is zero
Badge count displays '9+' for counts greater than 9
Notification icon is accessible via keyboard (Tab navigation, Enter to activate)

userStories.title: User Profile Access
userStories.story: As a System Administrator, I want to access my user profile and account settings from the top bar, so that I can manage my preferences, change password, and log out without navigating away from my current work
acceptanceCriteria: User avatar/profile icon is visible in the top-right corner of the top bar
Clicking the user icon opens a dropdown menu with options: View Profile, Account Settings, Help & Documentation, Log Out
Dropdown menu is positioned below the user icon and aligned to the right edge
User icon displays current user's initials or profile photo
Profile menu is accessible via keyboard
Clicking outside the dropdown menu closes it
Log Out option requires confirmation before signing user out
Profile icon is distinguishable from notification icon

userStories.title: Application Branding & Identity
userStories.story: As an Operations Manager, I want to see the PMM logo and application name clearly displayed in the navigation, so that I can quickly identify which system I'm working in (especially when managing multiple applications or browser tabs)
acceptanceCriteria: PMM logo (orange icon with factory/mill graphic) is displayed at the top of the sidebar
'Pennant Mill Manager' text is displayed below or beside the logo in expanded sidebar mode
Logo and text use brand colors (orange #F97316 for icon, white text)
Logo area is clickable and navigates to Dashboard (home page)
Application name 'Pennant Mill Manager' is also displayed in the top bar for reinforcement
Logo and branding are visible in both expanded and collapsed sidebar states
Logo area has adequate padding and visual separation from navigation items

userStories.title: Keyboard Navigation
userStories.story: As a Power User (Cost Accountant), I want to navigate between modules using keyboard shortcuts, so that I can work more efficiently without switching between keyboard and mouse
acceptanceCriteria: Tab key moves focus through navigation items in logical order (top to bottom)
Enter or Space key activates the focused navigation item
Focus indicator is clearly visible (outline or highlight on focused item)
Keyboard shortcuts are available for common modules (Alt+D, Alt+I, etc.)
Keyboard shortcuts are documented in Help section
Escape key closes any open dropdown menus (profile, notifications)
Focus returns to main content area after navigation completes
Keyboard navigation works in both expanded and collapsed sidebar states

userStories.title: Mobile/Tablet Responsive Navigation
userStories.story: As a Warehouse Staff member using a mobile device, I want the navigation to adapt to smaller screens, so that I can access all PMM modules on my phone or tablet while on the warehouse floor
acceptanceCriteria: On screens < 768px width, sidebar collapses to a hamburger menu icon
Hamburger menu icon is positioned in the top-left corner of the top bar
Clicking hamburger menu opens sidebar as an overlay (slides in from left)
Overlay sidebar displays full navigation items with icons and text
Clicking outside the overlay or on a navigation item closes the sidebar
Close button (X) is visible in the top-right of the overlay sidebar
Sidebar overlay does not block access to top bar (notifications, profile)
Touch targets for navigation items are minimum 44x44px for accessibility
Active state indication remains visible in mobile view
Swipe gesture (left-to-right) can also open the sidebar on touch devices

userStories.title: Screen Reader Accessibility
userStories.story: As a visually impaired Finance Manager using a screen reader, I want the navigation to be fully accessible with assistive technology, so that I can navigate PMM independently and efficiently
acceptanceCriteria: All navigation items have descriptive ARIA labels
Active navigation item is announced as 'current page' or 'selected'
Sidebar collapse/expand button has clear label
Notification badge count is announced (e.g., '3 unread notifications')
Navigation landmark is properly marked with <nav> element and role='navigation'
Focus order is logical and matches visual layout
Icon-only elements (in collapsed mode) have text alternatives
Screen reader announces page title changes when navigating to new module
Skip navigation link is provided to jump directly to main content
No keyboard traps exist in navigation interactions

userStories.title: Navigation Performance
userStories.story: As a Manufacturing Engineer, I want navigation interactions to feel instant and responsive, so that I can work fluidly without frustrating delays when switching between modules
acceptanceCriteria: Clicking a navigation item provides immediate visual feedback (< 100ms)
Active state change occurs before page navigation begins
Sidebar collapse/expand animation completes within 300ms
Navigation does not block or freeze the UI during page transitions
Loading indicators are shown if module takes > 1 second to load
Navigation remains interactive during page loads (no disabled state)
No visual jank or layout shifts during navigation transitions
Navigation state (active item, collapsed/expanded) loads within 500ms on page refresh
Performance is consistent across supported browsers

functionalRequirements.title: Sidebar Structure & Layout
functionalRequirements.description: Persistent left sidebar navigation providing access to all six PMM core modules with clear visual hierarchy and consistent structure
keyFeatures: Six navigation items in fixed order

functionalRequirements.title: Active State Management
functionalRequirements.description: Orange highlight indicator showing current module location with automatic state updates on navigation
keyFeatures: Single active state at all times
Automatic state derivation from current route

functionalRequirements.title: Sidebar Collapse/Expand Functionality
functionalRequirements.description: Toggle between full sidebar (icons + text) and compact sidebar (icons only) to maximize screen space
keyFeatures: Collapse button at bottom of sidebar
Tooltips on hover in collapsed mode

functionalRequirements.title: Top Bar - Notification System
functionalRequirements.description: Real-time notification badge showing unread alert count with visual prominence
keyFeatures: Bell icon with badge in top-right area
Badge hidden when count is zero

functionalRequirements.title: Top Bar - User Profile & Account Access
functionalRequirements.description: User profile icon with dropdown menu for account settings, help, and logout
keyFeatures: Profile photo or generated initials display

functionalRequirements.title: Application Title Bar
functionalRequirements.description: Application name display in top bar for branding and tab identification
keyFeatures: 'Pennant Mill Manager' text in top bar
Dynamic browser tab title with current module

functionalRequirements.title: Navigation Icons
functionalRequirements.description: Distinct, recognizable icons for each module supporting visual scanning and accessibility
keyFeatures: Consistent icon library (Heroicons, Lucide, or Phosphor)
ARIA-hidden with text labels for accessibility

iconMapping.Reportes: Bar chart or document with graph

functionalRequirements.title: Responsive Navigation (Mobile/Tablet)
functionalRequirements.description: Overlay/drawer navigation for mobile devices with hamburger menu and touch gestures
keyFeatures: Sidebar slides in as overlay from left

functionalRequirements.title: Keyboard Shortcuts
functionalRequirements.description: Keyboard shortcuts for instant navigation to primary modules

behavior.globalScope: Works from any page within PMM
behavior.textFieldException: Shortcuts ignored when focus is in text input
behavior.documentation: Displayed in tooltips and Help section

functionalRequirements.title: Navigation Performance & Loading States
functionalRequirements.description: Instant visual feedback with progressive loading indicators for slower navigation

nonFunctionalRequirements.description: All navigation interactions must feel instant and responsive
Navigation system must be fully accessible to users with disabilities (WCAG 2.1 AA compliance)
requirements: Keyboard navigation: 100% of functions accessible via keyboard
Screen reader: All elements properly labeled with ARIA attributes
Color contrast: Minimum 4.5:1 for text, 3:1 for icons
Touch targets: Minimum 44x44px on mobile devices
Focus indicators: Clear visual focus state for keyboard users

nonFunctionalRequirements.description: Navigation system must work consistently across all supported browsers
Navigation must be responsive and performant on mobile devices
Navigation structure must support additional modules without redesign

scalabilityTargets.subNavigation: Support nested menus for complex modules

nonFunctionalRequirements.description: Navigation system must protect user data and respect privacy
requirements: No sensitive data in localStorage (only UI preferences)
User profile data transmitted over HTTPS only
Session tokens not exposed in browser console or network logs
Notification badge does not reveal sensitive alert details

nonFunctionalRequirements.description: Navigation labels must support multiple languages

technical: Next.js 16 (App Router for SSR navigation state)
Tailwind CSS 4 for styling and responsive breakpoints
WebSocket or polling for real-time notifications

activities: Focus on keyboard navigation, accessibility, and performance
Collect feedback on navigation flow and usability
Deploy to 20% of production users (selected sites)
Collect user feedback via in-app survey

goNoGoCriteria: Navigation-related support tickets < 10 per week (for 100-user pilot)

futureEnhancements.description: Show/hide modules based on user permissions with custom navigation for different user roles
Dropdown panel showing recent alerts with quick actions (acknowledge, dismiss, view details)
Users can pin frequently accessed sub-pages to navigation for quick access
Global search within navigation (find module or page by name) with Ctrl+K/Cmd+K shortcut
Dark theme for navigation and entire application with user preference stored in settings
Expandable sub-menus for complex modules (e.g., Reportes → Production Reports, Inventory Reports)
